solution_line_template: If James only missed one question in all five rounds of five questions, he correctly answered {total_rounds} * {questions_per_round} - {questions_missed} = <<{total_rounds}*{questions_per_round}-{questions_missed}={correct_answers_total}>>{correct_answers_total} questions

Before the bonus, James earned {correct_answers_total} correct answers * {points_per_correct_answer} points/answer = <<{correct_answers_total}*{points_per_correct_answer}={points_from_correct_answers}>>{points_from_correct_answers} points.

Since missing one question would only disqualify him from receiving a bonus in one round, he would earn a bonus for {total_rounds}-{rounds_disqualified_from_bonus}=<<{total_rounds}-{rounds_disqualified_from_bonus}={rounds_with_bonus}>>{rounds_with_bonus} rounds.
He should expect a bonus of {rounds_with_bonus} rounds* {bonus_points_per_round} points/round= <<{rounds_with_bonus}*{bonus_points_per_round}={total_bonus_points}>>{total_bonus_points} points.
Including his bonus, James scored a total of {points_from_correct_answers} + {total_bonus_points} = <<{points_from_correct_answers}+{total_bonus_points}={total_score}>>{total_score} points.
